intro: Stauracanthus genistoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf stauracanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring, followed by small, woody fruits. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
